content: by midknight designs customizable patchwork scarf jennifer l christensen i created this scarf with my beginner students in mind it s a very simple pattern consisting of joining patches of single and double_crochet into strips and embellish any way that you want 1 customizable patchwork scarf rated beginner/easy materials  worsted weight yarn approx 8 oz anywhere from 1 to 32 colors if you wish  this is a great stash-buster project if you do each patch in a different  color  size h/5 00mm hook or as needed for gauge  tapestry needle  pins to hold strips together for seaming  optional additional yarn any weight or embroidery floss for embellishments in contrasting colors any other embellishments as desired gauge single_crochet patch a 4 single_crochet = 1 & 3 row = 1 double_crochet patch b 4 double_crochet = 1 & 2 row = 1 patch a 3 x 3 ¼ patch b 6 x 3 ¼ finished length approx 72 the length can be varied by making more or less of the patches keeping the patch count an even number abbreviations chain stitch chain single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet 2 instructions note leave 1 tail long at least 6 inches on every patch for sewing patches together later chains at the beginning of every row is also called turning chains whether or not the chain is considered the first stitch of the row patch a single_crochet patch photo 1 make 16 for 72 scarf chain chain 13 row 1 single_crochet single_crochet in 2nd chain chain from hook and in each chain chain across 12 single_crochet row 2 - 12 chain chain 1 chain does not count as a stitch turn work single_crochet single_crochet in each single_crochet single_crochet across 12 single_crochet finish off patch b double_crochet patch photo 2 make 16 for 72 scarf chain chain 14 row 1 double_crochet double_crochet in 4th chain chain from hook and in each chain chain across 12 double_crochet row 2 12 chain chain 3 chain counts as the 1st stitch in every row turn work skip first double_crochet double_crochet in previous row double_crochet double_crochet in next double_crochet double_crochet and in each double_crochet double_crochet across 12 double crochet note when you reach the last stitch in the previous row the chain 3 turning chain make your last double_crochet in the 3rd top chain finish off 3 assembly make 2 strips alternating 8 of patch a photo 1 and 8 of patch b photo 2 for 72 scarf using the long tail on one of the patches whip stitch end to end together forming a strip when strips are completed join yarn in any corner of a strip 3 single_crochet in corner single_crochet evenly around strip with 3 single_crochet n each corner joining with a slip_stitch in 1st single_crochet and finish off repeat with 2nd strip weave in ends tip excluding the 3 single_crochet in each corner there should be 12 single_crochet along the long side of the single_crochet patches a and 24 single_crochet
